Threatened and endangered species can be consulted on the CITES website (Annex A to Regulation (EC) No 338/97).

The regulation of the experimental use of these species is specified in the article 20 of Royal Decree 53/13, according to which these animals can only be used if the following two conditions are met:

  • The project has one of the following purposes:
    • a) Prevention, prophylaxis, diagnosis or treatment of diseases, health problems or other anomalies or their effects on humans, animals or plants
    • b) The protection of the natural environment in the interest of the health or well-being of humans or animals.
    • c) Research aimed at the conservation of species.
  • It has been scientifically justified that this purpose cannot be achieved using animals of other species.

This section also includes the use of primates as experimental animals, for which the provisions of the Royal Decree 1386/2018, of November 19, which modifies Royal Decree 53/2013.
